head.title: A Tart Approach To Turkey Leftovers

hedline.hl1: A Tart Approach To Turkey Leftovers

abstract.p: Marian Burros Plain & Simple column on making a meal with Turkey leftovers; recipes (S)

block.p: At last! A recipe for leftover turkey and relish that's not just a way to get rid of them. What you need is a relish that has some tang and bitterness, not just sweetness. For additional tartness, add some dried cranberries.

At last! A recipe for leftover turkey and relish that's not just a way to get rid of them. What you need is a relish that has some tang and bitterness, not just sweetness. For additional tartness, add some dried cranberries.
A tart-sweet salad of arugula, apple and Roquefort.
1 1/2 cups no-salt-added chicken stock or broth
12 ounces whole onion or 11 ounces chopped, ready-cut onion
4 ounces whole green pepper or 3 ounces chopped, ready-cut pepper
Freshly ground black pepper to taste.

1. Combine the rice, stock or broth, bay leaf, cumin, cinnamon and nutmeg; bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer. Cover, and cook for a total of 17 minutes, until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed.
2. Chop the whole onion. Heat a nonstick pan until it is very hot, reduce heat to medium high, add the oil and saute the onion until it begins to soften.
3. Meanwhile, wash, trim, seed and chop the whole pepper, add to onion and cook until pepper begins to soften.
4. Cut up the turkey, and stir into the onions with the relish and the cranberries.
5. Add the cooked rice; remove the bay leaf, and mix the rice with the turkey mixture. Season with salt and pepper.
Approximate nutritional analysis per serving: 690 calories, 12 grams fat, 110 milligrams cholesterol, 320 milligrams sodium, 50 grams protein, 90 grams carbohydrate.
1. Thoroughly wash the arugula, remove tough stems and dry.
2. Whisk together the oil and vinegar. Break up the Roquefort, and stir in.
3. Wash, dry, core and thinly slice the apple. Stir into the dressing.
4. Break the arugula into bite-size pieces, and stir into the dressing.
Approximate nutritional analysis per serving: 120 calories, 6 grams fat, 3 milligrams cholesterol, 90 milligrams sodium, 2 grams protein, 14 grams carbohydrate.
Prepare pilaf through Step 3. Prepare salad through Step 2. Finish pilaf. Finish salad.
